subject: Re: How to test error handling?
msgSnippet: ... Mock as be used for this.  If you can mock the object that can throw the exception, you can configurate to just throw it when called.  Then you can test
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:

> You need to force an object to throw the particular SQLException you
> want to throw into the object that is supposed to handle it. Without
> knowing what those objects are, I can't write a better description of
> the solution.

Mock as be used for this. If you can mock the object that can throw
the exception, you can configurate to just throw it when called. Then
you can test that the exception was handled correctly.

Dave
